thread.title: Democrats to meet in Atlanta to decide their party's future
thread.title_full: Democrats to meet in Atlanta to decide their party's future

author: David Allison
title: Democrats to meet in Atlanta to decide their party's future
text: Democrats to meet in Atlanta to decide their party's future Feb 21, 2017, 6:00am EST Industries & Tags David Allison Editor Atlanta Business Chronicle Share David Allison Editor Atlanta Business Chronicle Bizspace Spotlight Enlarge The DNC will meet at the Westin Peachtree Plaza hotel. More than 400 members of the Democratic National Committee are scheduled to kick off a meeting in Atlanta on Feb. 25 to decide the party's future. "After suffering major losses in last yearâ€™s presidential and congressional elections, the party will elect a new chair on Saturday at the conclusion of its three-day winter meeting at downtown's Westin Peachtree Plaza," reports 11Alive.com. Read more here . Enlarge The DNC will meet at the Westin Peachtree Plaza hotel. "The 2016 election loss to Trump looms large, to be sure, and candidates have argued for more on-the-ground involvement in state parties to cultivate a broader voter base and a bench of candidates," notes a Feb. 16 story from Real Clear Politics about the DNC meeting in Atlanta. Minnesota Rep. Keith Ellison is a contender to win the chairman's position after receiving the endorsement of New Hampshire Democratic Party Chairman Raymond Buckley , Politico.com reports. Read more here . Bizspace Spotlight
